intro: Centranthera tonkinensis var. fastigiata, commonly known as the upright centranthera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
